overview_of_class: The focus of this course is an overview of research and theory related to children's cognitive development from infancy through adolescence, with a primary focus on early childhood. Among the topics we will cover are theories of cognitive development, conceptual development, problem solving, language, comparative cognition, memory, reasoning, and theory of mind. We will consider classic theories and studies as well as more recent research that addresses these topics.
name: Cognitive Development
title: WCAS PSYCH 362-0-20 Cognitive Development
enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Prerequisite: Students must complete Psych 205-0 before taking this course.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Primarily discussion, supplemented with videos and some brief lectures.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Grades will be based on weekly written discussion questions, finding and summarizing empirical research articles, participation in class discussion, an empirical research proposal, and possibly an in-class presentation and/or being a discussion facilitator.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Goswani, U. (ed). (2013). Handbook of Childhood Cognitive Development, 2nd edition. Wiley-Blackwell. ISBN: 978-1118586662.

In addition to the book, we will use a number of articles and resources from other sources, which will be available in the Canvas course management system.
